        public static boolean isValidPassword(java.lang.String password)
                               throws Assignments.Fall2020.Assignment1.MySolution.Exceptions.LengthException,
                                      Assignments.Fall2020.Assignment1.MySolution.Exceptions.NoUpperAlphaException,

                                      Assignments.Fall2020.Assignment1.MySolution.Exceptions.NoSpecialCharacterException,
                                      Assignments.Fall2020.Assignment1.MySolution.Exceptions.InvalidSequenceException
        Return true if valid password (follows all rules from above), returns false if an invalid password
        Parameters:
        password - - string to be checked for validity
        Returns:
        true if valid password (follows all rules from above), false if an invalid password
        Throws:
        Assignments.Fall2020.Assignment1.MySolution.Exceptions.LengthException - thrown if length is less than 6 characters
        Assignments.Fall2020.Assignment1.MySolution.Exceptions.NoUpperAlphaException - thrown if no uppercase alphabetic

        Assignments.Fall2020.Assignment1.MySolution.Exceptions.NoDigitException - thrown if no digit

      • isWeakPassword

        public static boolean isWeakPassword(java.lang.String password)
        Checks if password is valid but not between 6 -9 characters
        Parameters:
        password - - string to be checked if weak password
        Returns:
        true if length of password is between 6 and 9 (inclusive).

      • getInvalidPasswords

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getInvalidPasswords(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> passwords)
        Reads a file of passwords and the passwords that failed the check will be added to an invalidPasswords with the reason
        Parameters:
        passwords - - list of passwords read from a file
        Returns:
        invalidPasswords - ArrayList of invalid passwords in the correct format
